results.title: Beyond the schoolroom
results.brief_description: Describes the plan for shared responsibility of high school students at Millbrook School, N.Y.. Shows assigned jobs that contribute to the schools’ effective functioning and add meaning and interest to the life of the students. By encouraging its pupils to take jobs in the school’s store, bank, post office, fire department, zoo, photographic service, etc, the school prepares boys as responsible, community-minded citizens.

results.title: Beyond the pack ice
results.brief_description: Describes life on the inhospitable Antarctic continent. Animal and plant life is sparse but man has established himself. At the Mawson research station intensive study programmes include auroral physics, meteorology and medicine. The four months of daylight are packed with outdoor activities. Shows the annual arrival of the supply ship from Australia and describes some of the emotions of the men on the expedition.

results.title: Beyond the naked eye
results.creator_credit: Claudia Overing, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of marvels, an amazing view of the living, pulsing universe contained in a single drop of water from a fish aquarium. Colour film and a microscope, and the infinite patience of the filmmakers, reveal life that no-one would ordinarily see. This is a view of creation, of birth, life and death, of the laws of nature that apply even to the smallest of living things. It is a film that will add knowledge and insight to the pleasure of any audience. Photographers: Eric Chamberlain, Claudia Overing. Narrated by Sharry Plett and Albert Martin. Awards: Tehran; Belgrade; Melbourne.

results.title: Beyond the frame (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: B.Z. Vincent-Batyka, Royal College of Art (Great Britain) and Tate Gallery
results.brief_description: In attempting to break down the barriers between art galleries and the general public, the Tate Gallery gives lectures to groups of adults and is involved in a special program for children, called Kid’s Play, to help them appreciate the different types and forms of art.

results.title: Beyond the boom: metal mining in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle, Australian Mining Industry Council and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: The evolution of mining in Australia from the first gold discoveries to the iron, nickel and copper developments of the 1960’s , its historic importance in national growth and economic stability and in the exploration and settling of much of Australia. The scope of modern mining and processing industries, exploration and prospecting, the growth of new towns and stimulation of regional development.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle, Australian Mining Industry Council and Fraser Castle Productions

results.title: Beyond silence
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Milner-Fenwick and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: The story of Gallaudet College in Washington D.C., where the deaf are trained to prepare themselves for the hearing world. Follows a new student from class to class and shows how the deaf are simultaneously taught lip-reading and sign language in the course of enrollment in a regular four year college curriculum leading to a Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree. Explains that hearing students from other countries receive instruction at the Gallaudet Graduate School in the art of teaching the deaf.

results.title: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Film Associates and Paul Burnford Film Productions

video_links.name: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers

results.brief_description: This 1960’s film is about the communication gap between two generations: teenagers and young adults on the one hand, and the generation of those over thirty - “the establishment”. The teenagers’ use of LSD and other drugs is only one of the symptoms of this communication gap. A group of parents desperately seek help in order to understand what has gone wrong. The film is an attempt to go “beyond LSD” and is intended to stimulate discussion amongst high school students, college students, teachers and parents. Ample involuntary hilarity can result from viewing this great hysterical/historical document. Starting as a raucous celluloid freak-out, the film presents its square’s-eye view of the “Generation Gap” through the fictive device of a round table of pod people, each alike in their helmet-hair and cat’s eye glasses. The production crew of this film was primarily made up of teenagers and young adults. Music by ‘The Stayns.’ A minor masterpiece of psychedelic cinema.
results.title_for_label: Beyond LSD: a film for concerned adults and teenagers
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Film Associates and Paul Burnford Film Productions

results.title: Beyond hell's gate
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson, Film Australia, Nomad Films and Satonyx Films
results.brief_description: Three trailbike riders retrace the route that led 15,000 Chinese and 1,500 Europeans from Cooktown through Hell’s Gate to the Palmer Goldfields of Northern Queensland. Partly dramatised, it recounts the coming of the Chinese, conflicts with local people and shows remnants of Maytown, the old mining settlement of Christie Palmerston, a legendary figure of the period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Peter Johnson, Film Australia, Nomad Films and Satonyx Films

results.title: Beyond curtains = Ni scene ni coulisses (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Denis Poulin, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Three dancers move through abstract motions. Sometimes they move against backgrounds, sometimes they incorporate Electro-accoustical music which further heightens the other worldly atmosphere of this experimental dance film.
